definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to exceed/to go beyond/to transcend/to cross over/to jump over
generic word for peoples or states of south China or south Asia at different historical periods/abbr. for Vietnam 越南
to exceed/to climb over/to surpass/the more... the more

sentences.english: Beyond language barriers, there exists an insurmountable artistic preference barrier.
sentences.chinese: 除了语言障碍，还有不可逾越的文化壁垒。

sentences.english: No one can jump a centimetre higher than the height he can jump.
sentences.chinese: 任何人不可逾越高度一分一厘。

sentences.english: A piece of impassable bog with yield of liquid peat.
sentences.chinese: 一个不可逾越的泥沼区。

sentences.english: Unbridgeable gaps existed between these three groups.
sentences.chinese: 这三个群体间存在不可逾越的鸿沟。

sentences.english: It's the kind of approach that turns an athletic team into an unsurpassed champion.
sentences.chinese: 这是把一个运动队变为不可逾越的冠军的那种方法。
这些问题似乎不可逾越。

sentences.english: The industrialization is an unbridgeable period in the process of economy development in every country.
sentences.chinese: 工业化是各国经济发展过程中不可逾越的一个阶段。

sentences.english: He believed there was an unbridgeable gulf between him and his parents.
sentences.chinese: 他认为自己与父母之间有不可逾越的鸿沟。

definition: (fig.) gulf/chasm/wide gap/(originally) the Hong Canal in Henan, which in ancient times formed the border between enemies Chu 楚 and Han 漢|汉
too high to reach (idiom); eminent and unapproachable

pinyin: ke3 wang4 er2 bu4 ke3 ji2

definition: to climb over/to get over (difficulties)/to scale/to surmount
solid as a boulder (idiom); absolutely secure/rock-firm and unyielding
in sight but unattainable (idiom)/inaccessible/also written 可望而不可及[ke3 wang4 er2 bu4 ke3 ji2]
pinyin: ke3 wang4 er2 bu4 ke3 ji2
shen2 sheng4 bu4 ke3 qin1 fan4
